episode_title: 410 - The One With The Girl From Poughkeepsie

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth. (Joey, with an obvious mouth full, nods yes.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 15? (Joey nods again) Your personal best! (Ross takes an Oreo and Joey mumbles, no!)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where were you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.
(simultaneously)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, which museum?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, answer his.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie? (laughs, at they all look at him) That joke would’ve killed in Albany.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now? (He smiles and has cookie remains all over his teeth.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look at this! (Holding a newspaper) They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! (hearing this, Gunther moves in) Y’know, I want a man !! (Gunther leaves depressed) I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?
(Monica enters)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s wrong Mon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? (Monica shows her, her hat.) Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good enough to get fired.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, you’re hired!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.
content.parenthetical: he glares at him for a while

content.description: Chandler’s office, he is trying to find Rachel a date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? (Drew looks at him) Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!

content.speaker: Drew
content.text: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.

content.speaker: Drew
content.text: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, by the way, that is her full name.

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: Oh wow! I’m free for her!

content.speaker: Drew
content.text: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?

content.speaker: Drew
content.text: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s !!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is working on a new song.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?

content.speaker: Monica, Rachel, and Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, that’s great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All good, thanks. (to Rachel) Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello, children!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Have I got the 50 guys for you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! (to Joey) Knicks tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! Where are the seats?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, will I like any of these guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You work with robots!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. (to Rachel) Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op, I like credit cards!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so what does he do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Your company has a fine foods division?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No, the robots just work for them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah! With who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, man!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damn! (runs out to work)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket? (sees there’s a burn spot on it)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it! Oh-oh! (He starts patting the burned spot, which just happens to be over her breast.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, like father, like son.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know, possibly. (pause) You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ummmmmmmm, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

content.description: Allesandro’s, Joey is eating some cheese.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.

content.speaker: A Waiter
content.text: Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday. (hands him two envelopes)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Because we can remember them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Well, sure, that too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Can’t hear you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No ma’am.

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. (to another waiter) We did the hat right? (The other waiter nods yes.)

content.description: Allesandro’s, continued from earlier. The other waiters are gone and Monica is confronting Joey about his not speaking up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What the hell happened?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, “Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… (tries to do the math in his head, but can’t) 327 + 238 dollars!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What kinda things have you been saying?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is working on her holiday song, Chandler is sitting on the couch reading a magazine, and Ross is sleeping on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not Jewish, so…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God! (Phoebe hits her guitar which wakes up Ross with a start.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bad dream?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wasn’t sleeping.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, did you pick one yet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Prague?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is playing living room golf as Rachel enters. Rachel sees this and holds the door open until Chandler is ready to start his swing, when he is, she slams the door shut which causes the club to fly from his hands. He turns around, shocked.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did! I absolutely did!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You idiot!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sure you’re right, but why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know! I know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks! (She sits down heavily in one of the new chairs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once. (He sits down on the arm of her chair)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it doesn’t matter. (Kisses her on the top of her head.) Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that sounds fun too. (They hug.)
(pause)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Have you ever been with a woman?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So there is no good time to ask that question.

content.description: A train to Poughkeepsie, Ross is asleep against the window.

content.speaker: The Conductor
content.text: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!

content.speaker: The Woman From Poughkeepsie
content.text: Ross? Ross! (she knocks on the window) Wake up! Ross! (the train starts moving) Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?

content.speaker: Kitchen Worker
content.text: I don’t speak English.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You did a minute ago!

content.speaker: Kitchen Worker
content.text: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine!
(She goes into the freezer to get it herself, and leaves the door open. The waiter from earlier comes by and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: You found that handle, did ya?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not funny.

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: Well that’s not true.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?

content.speaker: The Waiter
content.text: No, it’s really good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!

content.description: The train, it’s pulling into a station.

content.speaker: The Conductor
content.text: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (notices that there is now a beautiful woman sitting next to him)

content.speaker: Woman On Train
content.text: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Woman On Train
content.text: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are we really in Montreal?!

content.speaker: Woman On Train
content.text: Yes we are. So, coffee?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Coffee sounds great. (They get up) Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?

content.speaker: Woman On Train
content.text: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

content.description: Allesandro’s, Joey is coming back in with his coat on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Enough!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Lean-lean-lean!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing her holiday song.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “ Went to the store, sat on Santa’s lap. Asked him to bring my friends all kind of crap. Said all you need is to write them a song. They haven’t heard it, so don’t try and sing along. No, don’t sing along.
Monica, Moncia, have a happy Chanukah. Saw Santa Clause, he said hello to Ross. And plese tell Joey, Christmas will be snowy! And Rachel and Chandler, have err-umm-glander!!”
Happy holidays, everybody!
